net.sf.clickclick.jquery.helper
Class JQHelper

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.clickclick.jquery.helper.JQHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
JQAutoCompleteHelper, JQFormHelper, JQRefreshHelper
public class JQHelper
extends Object
implements Serializable

Provide a JQuery helper that Ajax enables a target Control/s.

This helper has an associated JavaScript template that can be modified according to your needs. Click here to view the JQHelper template. You can set your own custom template using the method setTemplate(java.lang.String).

The default template is suited for Link based controls and most Field such as Buttons, TextFields, Selects, Checkboxes and Radio buttons. Sophisticated controls such as Forms, Tables and Trees would require customized templates eg: JQFormHelper.

JQHelper has two primary use cases:

  • To Embed JQHelper inside custom Controls. The custom Control then delegates to JQHelper to add the necessary JavaScript and Ajax behavior.
  • To Ajax enable non-ajax Controls in a Page. Here JQHelper is used to "decorate" target Controls with the necessary JavaScript and Ajax behavior.
Here are two examples of using embedding as well as decorating JQHelper.

Embedded example

Below is an example of a custom control with an embedded JQHelper that provides Ajax behavior: 
 public class JQSubmit extends Submit {

     // The embedded JQuery helper object.
     protected JQHelper jqHelper;

     // Constructor
     public JQSubmit(String name) {
         super(name);
     }

     public JQHelper getJQueryHelper() {
         if (jqHelper == null) {
             jqHelper = new JQHelper(this);
         }
         return jqHelper;
     }

     // During onInit event the control is registered as an Ajax control
     @Override
     public void onInit() {
         super.onInit();

         // 1. Register the control with Click so it can handle Ajax requests.
         // Registration should occur within the "onInit" event. This ensures
         // the Ajax Control can be used within stateful Pages
         jqHelper.registerAjaxControl(this);
     }

     @Override
     public List getHeadElements() {
         if (headElements == null) {
             headElements = super.getHeadElements();

             // 2. Bind the submit button ID attribute for "click" events.
             // From this binding the JQHelper template will render the
             // following JavaScript code: "jQuery.live('#form_submit', 'onclick', someFunction)
             // where "someFunction" is defined in the JQHelper template
             getJQueryHelper().bind(getId(), JQEvent.CLICK);

             // 3. Add the JavaScript template and other supporting libraries
             // to the control HEAD elements
             getJQueryHelper().addHeadElements(headElements);
         }
         return headElements;
     }
 }
To use JQSubmit to receive Ajax requests you need to set an net.sf.clickclick.AjaxListener on JQSubmit: 
 public class AjaxDemo extends BorderPage {

     public AjaxDemo() {
         JQSubmit submit = new JQSubmit("mysubmit");

         // Register an Ajax listener on the submit (JQAjaxAdapter is an AjaxListener subclass)
         submit.setActionListener(new JQAjaxAdapter() {

             @Override
             public Partial onAjaxAction(Control source, JQEvent event) {
                 Taconite partial = new Taconite();
                 ...
                 return partial;
             }
         }
     }
 }

Decorate example

Below is an example how to decorate a non-ajax TextField to update a span element when the user types into the textfield: 
 public class FieldDemo extends BorderPage {

     private Field field = new TextField("field");
     private Span label = new Span("label", "label");

     public FieldDemo() {

         // Register an Ajax listener on the field which is invoked on every
         // "keyup" event.
         field.setActionListener(new AjaxAdapter() {

             @Override
             public Partial onAjaxAction(Control source) {
                 Taconite partial = new Taconite();

                 // Set the label content to the latest field value
                 label.add(new Text(field.getValue()));

                 // Replace the label in the browser with the new one
                 partial.replace(label);
                 return partial;
             }
         });

         JQHelper helper = new JQHelper(field);

         // Switch off the Ajax busy indicator
         helper.setShowIndicator(false);

         // Delay Ajax invoke for 350 millis, otherwise too many Ajax requests
         // are made to the server
         helper.setThreshold(350);

         // Set Ajax to fire on keyup events
         helper.setEvent(JQEvent.KEYUP);

         // Ajaxify the Field
         helper.ajaxify();

         addControl(field);
         addControl(label);
     }
 }

getErrorMessage

public String getErrorMessage()
Return the message to display when an error occurs during an Ajax request. If no value is set, this method will try and lookup a localized message using the target control for the key "ajax-error-message". If a message cannot be found a default value is set: "&;lt;h1>Error occurred!</h1>".

Returns:
the message to display wnen an error occurs during an Ajax request

setErrorMessage

public void setErrorMessage(String errorMessage)
Set the error message to display when an error occurs during an Ajax request.

Parameters:
errorMessage - the error message to display when an error occurs during an Ajax request

getThreshold

public int getThreshold()
Return the number of milliseconds to wait before the Ajax request is invoked.

Returns:
the number of milliseconds to wait before the Ajax request is invoked
See Also:
setThreshold(int)

setThreshold

public void setThreshold(int threshold)
Set the number of milliseconds to wait before the Ajax request is invoked, default value is 0, meaning requests are invoked immediately.

Please note: all further Ajax requests invoked within the threshold period are merged into a single request.

Parameters:
threshold - the threshold

getIndicatorMessage

public String getIndicatorMessage()
Return the message to display when an Ajax indicator (busy indicator) is shown. If no value is set, this method will try and lookup a localized message using the target control for the key "ajax-indicator-message". If a message cannot be found a default value is set: "&;lt;h1>Please wait...</h1>".

Returns:
the message to display wnen an Ajax indicator is shown

setIndicatorMessage

public void setIndicatorMessage(String indicatorMessage)
Set the message to display when an Ajax indicator (busy indicator) is shown. If no value is specified the the default value: "&;lt;h1>Please wait...</h1>" is used.

Please note: the indicator message will be enclosed inside single quotes ('). If the message itself contains single quotes, they must be escaped using two backslash (\\) characters e.g: "Please enter your \\'name\\'.".

Parameters:
indicatorMessage - the message to display wnen an Ajax indicator is shown

getIndicatorOptions

public String getIndicatorOptions()
Return the Ajax indicator (busy indicator) options.

Returns:
the target element that displays the Ajax indicator
See Also:
setIndicatorOptions(java.lang.String)

setIndicatorOptions

public void setIndicatorOptions(String indicatorOptions)
Set the Ajax indicator (busy indicator) options.

The Ajax indicator is based on the JQuery BlockUI plugin so you can use any of the options outlined here.

For example: 

 public String getIndicatorOptions() {
     String options =
     "css : {"
         + "  textAlign: 'right',"
         + "  color: 'blue'"
         + "},"
         + "centerX: false,"
         + "centerY: false";

     return options;
 }
Please note that the "message" option must be specified through setIndicatorMessage(java.lang.String) instead.

Parameters:
indicatorOptions - the Ajax indicator optiosn

getMessage

public String getMessage(String name)
Return the localized message for the given key, or null if not found.

This method will attempt to lookup the localized message in the getControl() parent's messages, which resolves to the Page's resource bundle.

If the message was not found, this method will attempt to look up the value in the /click-control.properties message properties file, through the method getMessages().

If still not found, this method will return null.

Parameters:
name - the name of the message resource
Returns:
the named localized message, or null if not found

getMessage

public String getMessage(String name,
                         Object arg)
Return the formatted message for the given resource name, message format argument and the context request locale, or null if no message was found.

getMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object[]) is invoked to retrieve the message for the specified name.

Parameters:
name - resource name of the message
arg - the message argument to format
Returns:
the named localized message for the control

getMessage

public String getMessage(String name,
                         Object[] args)
Return the formatted message for the given resource name, message format arguments and the context request locale, or null if no message was found.

getMessage(java.lang.String) is invoked to retrieve the message for the specified name.

Parameters:
name - resource name of the message
args - the message arguments to format
Returns:
the named localized message for the package or null if no message was found

createDefaultModel

public Map createDefaultModel()
Create a default data model for the Ajax template.

The following values are added:

  • "context" - the request context path e.g: '/myapp'
  • "bindings" - the JavaScript bindings for events
  • "control" - the target control
  • "selector" - the CSS selector
  • "event" - the event that initiates the Ajax request
  • "productionMode" - true if Click is running in a production mode (production or profile), false otherwise
  • "url" - the Ajax request URL
  • "type" - the type of the Ajax request, eg POST or GET
  • "threshold" - the threshold within which multiple Ajax requests are merged into a single request.
  • "showIndicator" - the showIndicator flag
  • "indicatorOptions" - the Ajax indicator options. Note that indicatorMessage is rendered as part of the options
  • "indicatorTarget" - the target element of the Ajax indicator
  • "errorMessage" - the message to display if an Ajax error occurs
  • "parameters" - the Ajax request parameters
  • "selector" - the CSS selector

Returns:
the default data model for the Ajax template

addHeadElements

public void addHeadElements(List headElements)
Add the necessary JavaScript imports and scripts to the given headElements list to enable Ajax requests.

Parameters:
headElements - the list which to add all JavaScript imports and scripts to enable Ajax requests

ajaxify

public void ajaxify(Control control,
                    String selector,
                    JQEvent event)
Ajaxifies the the given control so that its registered net.sf.clickclick.AjaxListener can be invoked for Ajax requests.

If the helper's default control is not set, the given control will be set as the new default control.

The given control cannot be null, however if the given CSS selector is null it will default to the value returned by net.sf.clickclick.util.AjaxUtils#getSelector(org.apache.click.Control).

This method does the following:

  • Regsiters the target control on the net.sf.clickclick.AjaxControlRegistry by invoking net.sf.clickclick.AjaxControlRegistry#registerAjaxControl(Control)
  • invokes addHeadElements(java.util.List) which adds the necessary JavaScript imports and scripts to enable Ajax requests
Please note: when invoking this method before or from the onInit event, it will only be executed after the onInit event. If this method is called after the onInit method, it will be executed immediately.

Parameters:
control - the control to ajaxify
selector - the CSS selector
event - the JavaScript event
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if control is null

ajaxify

public void ajaxify(Control control,
                    JQEvent event)
Ajaxifies the the given control so that its registered net.sf.clickclick.AjaxListener can be invoked for Ajax requests.

event - the JavaScript event

registerAjaxControl

public void registerAjaxControl(Control control)
Register the given control to be processed by the ClickServlet for Ajax requests.

This method delegates to net.sf.clickclick.AjaxControlRegistry#registerAjaxControl(org.apache.click.Control).

Parameters:
control - the control to register as an Ajax target
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if control is null

bind(java.lang.String, net.sf.clickclick.jquery.util.JQEvent)

bind

public void bind(String selector,
                 JQEvent event)
Synonymous to JQuery bind / live functionality.

This method provides an easy way to bind a CSS selector and JavaScript JQEvent.

For example the following snippet: 

 Form form = new Form("form");
 Submit submit = new Submit("ok");

 // NOTE: Add button to parent form before invoking #bind (see below for details)
 form.add(submit);

 jqHelper.bind('#' + submit.getId(), JQEvent.CLICK);
will render as follows: 
 jQuery('#form_ok').live('click', template);
Note: if the CSS selector passed to the #bind method is a Control's ID, ensure the Control is attached to its parent Container so that the full ID is passed in.

Parameters:
selector - the CSS selector to bind
event - the JavaScript event to bind

getContext

protected Context getContext()
Return the Context of the current request

Returns:
the Context of the current request

serializeParameters

protected String serializeParameters()
Return the Ajax request parameters as a serialized URL string.

The serialized string will consist of name/value pairs delimited by the '&' char. An example URL string could be: "firstname=John&lastname=Smith&age=12".

Returns:
the Ajax request parameters as a serialized URL string

addJSDebugScript

protected void addJSDebugScript(List headElements)
Add a special JsScript which enables detailed JavaScript log output to the given headElements list.

Please note: use the Firefox browser and Firebug plugin to view the logged output. However other browsers might also support logging output.

Parameters:
headElements - list which to add the debug script to

addTemplate

protected void addTemplate(List headElements)
Add the template content to the given headElements list.

Parameters:
headElements - list which to add the Ajax template to

getSelectorOrControlId

protected String getSelectorOrControlId()
Return the selector or the Control ID/name attribute if the selector is not set.

Returns:
return selector or Control ID/name attribute
